Functionality: 3-4, The script contains one minor issue but nearly functions correctly. However, it fails to handle user input errors in the subtraction function.
Logic: 7-12, The logical structures are simple with some errors. Basic operations are mostly correct with minor inaccuracies. In this case, the script does not check the data types of the inputs before performing arithmetic operations, leading to an error when a string is subtracted from an integer.
Code Quality: 3-6, The code has poorly structured functions and non-idiomatic Python syntax. It also violates PEP 8 standards by using lowercase letters in function names instead of CamelCase or snake_case.
User Input Handling: 2-4, Minimal input validation is present; frequent errors and crashes occur on unexpected input. In this case, the script does not check the data types of user inputs before performing arithmetic operations, leading to an error when a string is passed as an argument to a function expecting integers or floats.
Documentation: 1-2, Minimal or no documentation is present; many sections of the code are undocumented. The script does not include any comments explaining its functionality or purpose.
